numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Many 15- to 24-year-olds say that the world is getting better with each generation.
2. I notice that there is not much correlation between a country and the positivity of the country towards the future.
3. This graph includes some countries from around the world.
4. This graph does not include China.
5. This graph does not include Korea.
6. This graph does not include Norway.
7. I wonder if the older generation is generally less positive towards the future.
8. I think that older people have lived longer.
9. I think that older people have seen the past.
10. I think that older people see the present as less good than the past.
11. I think that older people see the future as less good than the past.
12. A 50-year-old person probably lived childhood without phones.
13. A 50-year-old person probably lived adolescence without computers.
14. A 50-year-old person probably lived adolescence without the internet.
15. A 15-year-old person probably lived most of life with phones.
16. A 15-year-old person probably lived most of life with the internet.
17. A 50-year-old person might be more opposed to phones and the internet than a 15-year-old person.
18. I wonder if older generations are generally more pessimistic.
19. I wonder if older generations are only pessimistic about the future of the world.
20. I wonder what this graph would look like if it was made 20 years ago.
21. I wonder what this graph would look like if it was made 50 years ago.
22. I wonder what this graph would look like if it was made 100 years ago.
23. This topic relates to me and my community.
24. I have friends.
25. My friends are 15- to 24-year-olds.
26. My friends seem to be open to change.
27. My friends seem to be positive towards the future.
28. Some adults are around me.
29. The adults around me are more neutral towards the future.
30. The adults around me are slightly negative towards the future.
31. The headline is: The World is Getting Better, But for Who?
